raw: * Dynamically load non qx scripts. This class is aware of all scripts that have
* been loaded using its instances, so if two instances load jquery, it will only
* be loaded once, and the second instance will wait for the jquery to be loaded
* before continuing to load additional scripts.
*    // in debug mode load the uncompressed unobfuscated scripts

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Dynamically load non qx scripts. This class is aware of all scripts that have been loaded using its instances, so if two instances load jquery, it will only be loaded once, and the second instance will wait for the jquery to be loaded before continuing to load additional scripts. Usage example: 

  ... assets ...
 /**
* @asset(myapp/jquery/*)
* @asset(myapp/highcharts/*)
*
* @ignore(jQuery.*)
* @ignore(Highcharts.*)
  ...

    var src = '';
    var min = '.min';
    if (qx.core.Environment.get("qx.debug")) {
      src = '.src';
      min = '';
    }

    var dynLoader = new qx.util.DynamicScriptLoader([
        "myapp/jquery/jquery"+min+".js",
        "myapp/highcharts/highcharts"+src+".js",
        "myapp/highcharts/highcharts-more"+src+".js",
        "myapp/highcharts/highcharts-modifications.js"
    ]);
    dynLoader.addListenerOnce('ready',function(e){
      console.log("all scripts have been loaded!");
    });
    dynLoader.addListener('failed',function(e){
      var data = e.getData();
      console.log("failed to load "+data.script);
    });
    dynLoader.start();

raw: * fired when a script is loaded successfully. The data contains 'script' and 'status' keys.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: fired when a script is loaded successfully. The data contains 'script' and 'status' keys.

raw: * fired when a specific script fails loading.  The data contains 'script' and 'status' keys.

raw: * True if start has been called.
* Start loading scripts. This may only be called once!
* @return {Promise?} a promise which will be resolved after load of all scripts if promise support is enabled; nothing (undefined) if promises are not enabled.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Start loading scripts. This may only be called once!

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Promise?} a promise which will be resolved after load of all scripts if promise support is enabled; nothing (undefined) if promises are not enabled.
@return.description: a promise which will be resolved after load of all scripts if promise support is enabled; nothing (undefined) if promises are not enabled.

raw: * Recursively called until the array of scripts is consumed

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Chain loading scripts. Recursively called until the array of scripts is consumed
